category.term: 0~The Paley Center for Media~Russ Krasnoff~Malcolm-Jamal Warner~Entertainment Weekly
category.label: InformQString

content.div:
Days after photos of Community's March 15 episode surfaced online, the cast and executives convened at the Paley Center for Media's annual PaleyFest to talk about the show's anticipated mid-season return, as well as its future.

"We're feeling pretty confident," executive producer Russ Krasnoff told the audience, giving the show a "63 percent" chance of renewal because "the people at NBC love the show."

Creator Dan Harmon confirmed that an official decision won't be made until May but says there is still a lot to look forward to in the rest of Season 3. According to EW.com, the season's remaining episodes include Shirley's re-marriage to ex-husband Andre (Malcolm Jamal Warner), the return of The Dreamatorium, a video game-themed episode, and a Chang army, which will be featured in the season finale.

The panel also included a discussion of a "boob game" played by the female cast members.

Check out pics of the show's March 15 return as well as the cast on Paleyfest's red carpet, then spend an hour or so with the Greendale gang below:

jond@dose.ca

link.Abstract: We're still streets ahead of Community's March 15th return but, thanks to NBC, we've got a sneak peek at the Greendale gang's comeback episode, "Urban Matrimony and the Sandwich Arts." So what can we expect from the show's "unbenching?" Check out the just released pics to find out.
